Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Thoughts

  • Apr 2, 2019 Sorcery, Spirits and Programming

    Rarely you find a book that is not only instructive, but beautifully written.

    For those who have not already guessed, this is a reference to Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs by Harold Abelson and Gerald Jay Sussman with Julie Sussman.

    For those that enjoy video support, there is also a youtube collection of videos from the lectures actually presented by Harold Abelson and Gerald Jay Sussman, with the original ‘86 flavor, can be found here.

  • Feb 1, 2019 Creating Configurable Spark Applications in Scala

    All of us can recall the first days of picking up a new technology and running the first “Hello World” or “Count Words” applications that get us started with a new language or a platform.
  • Jul 8, 2015 Homework Can Be Fun!

    These are some words that I never expected to say anymore during this lifetime.
